column1: The House of Durin was the line of the descendants of Durin
column2: eldest of the seven Fathers of the Dwarves.  The kingship of the line continued even when those with the title were in exile.

column1: ==The Family Tree of the House of Durin ==
Showing the descendants of Durin.  All information in the tree is from The Lord of the Rings
column3: "Durin’s Folk" unless otherwise specified.  The figures after the names are those of birth and death where recorded (when only one figure is shown it is the date of birth).  A dagger symbol
column4: † signifies those who did not die of old age.  A name preceded by * indicates one of the Kings of Durins Folk; an italicized name  denotes one of the companions of Thorin on the quest of Lonely Mountain.  A dashed line indicates a line of descent with some members missing.

column1: Durin III received the first of the Seven Rings.}}

column4: and Dori were also of the House of Durin

column7: and Bombur were descended from Dwarves of Khazad-dûm but not of Durins line.
